API Reference¶

PRISM to SMT Translation¶

Translation of a PRISM program to SMT commands.

pric3.prism_to_smt.translate_prism_to_smt(program)[source]¶

Translates a PRISM program to a smt script.

Parameters

program – The PRISM program with exactly one “main” module.

Return type

The SMT script that corresponds to checking the PRISM program.

class pric3.prism_to_smt.LoopProgram(program)[source]¶

An input PRISM program that models a loop with a guard, a goal and a main module.

Variables

  • program – the PRISM program

  • module – the main module of the program

  • guard – the expression labelled “guard”

  • goal – the expression labelled “goal”

  • env – the environment

class pric3.prism_to_smt.Env(module)[source]¶

Maintains an ordered list of program variables as symbols and has factory methods to create functions that operate on the environment.

function_symbol(name, return_type)[source]¶

Return a new FunctionType symbol that receives all environment variables as arguments.

forall(formula)[source]¶

Wrap formula in a forall quantifier with all environment variables.

apply(symbol, values={})[source]¶

Apply a function that takes all environment variables with optional valuations. TODO documentation

get(prism_var)[source]¶

Resolve a PRISM program variable to a symbol.

SMT API Wrapper¶

We build a wrapper around pySMT to allow for a nicer generation of SMTLib code with comments and generally nicer formatting.

pric3.smt.COMMENT = 'comment'¶

We add a new command type that is handled by our SmtScript to print comments. A command [COMMENT, line1, line2] generates two lines of comments.

class pric3.smt.SmtCommand[source]¶

A command to the SMT solver, which allows for COMMENT commands. Re-uses SmtLibCommand from pysmt.

Parameters

  • name – Command name from pysmt.commands or COMMENT.

  • args – List of arguments for the command.

serialize(printer)[source]¶

Serialize this command using a printer from pysmt.smtlib.printers.

serialize_to_string()[source]¶

Serialize this command directly to a string.

class pric3.smt.SmtScript[source]¶

A SmtScript contains a list of commands.

add_command(*, name, args)[source]¶

Add a new SmtCommand with the given name and arguments.

add_comment(*lines)[source]¶

Add a comment command.

add_declare_fun(symbol)[source]¶

Declare a function.

add_declare_const(symbol)[source]¶

Declare a constant.

add_assert_formula(formula)[source]¶

Add an assertion of a formula to the script. This assumes all necessary types and variables are already declared.

add_check_sat()[source]¶

Add a CHECK_SAT command.

serialize_to_smtlib()[source]¶

Serialize this SmtScript to a SMTLib script.

is_pure()[source]¶

Whether this script only contains assertions and declarations. This allows us to check satisfiability using the pySMT shortcuts without generating the SMTLib script explicitly.

to_pure_formula()[source]¶

If this script is pure (see is_pure), then we can generate a single pySMT formula from this script by simply ANDing all individual ASSERT formulas.

print_and_sat_pure()[source]¶

If this script is pure, print the SMTLib code and check if it is satisfiable. Returns the formula so you could do e.g. get_model(formula).

Utils¶

pric3.utils.intersperse(val, sequence)[source]¶

Insert val between each element in the sequence
